speaker: Alice
content: My name is Mary Alice Young.

speaker: Alice
content: When you read this morning's paper, you may come across an article about the unusual day I had last week.
mark: come across 偶然遇见 come across an article

speaker: Alice
content: Normally, there's never anything newsworthy about my life, but that all changed last Thursday.
mark: newsworthy 有新闻价值的 there's never anything newsworthy about my life.

speaker: Alice
content: Of course, everything seemed quite normal at first.

speaker: Alice
content: I made breakfast for my family,

speaker: Alice
mark: chore n.家庭杂务，杂活；累活，苦差事 I performed my chores. 我做了我的家务

speaker: Alice
mark: ran errands 跑腿，办事  I ran my errands. “我办了点事。” 或者 “我处理了一些琐事。”

speaker: Alice
content: In truth, I spent the day as I spent every other day, quietly polishing the routine of my life until it gleamed with perfection.
mark: In truth 真实地，说实话，事实上
polish 擦亮；改进
routine 常规，惯例
gleam 发微光，闪烁；显得光洁明亮 until it gleamed with perfection. 直至完美

speaker: Alice
content: That's why it was so astonishing when I decided to go to my hallway closet and retrieve a revolver that had never been used.
mark: astonish 使吃惊，使惊讶 That's why it was so astonishing...
hallway closet走廊壁橱 hallway 门厅，走廊；过道 closet 壁橱，储藏室
retrieve 找回，收回
revolver 左轮手枪；旋转器

speaker: Alice
content: My body was discovered by my neighbor, Mrs. Martha Huber, who'd been startled by a strange popping sound.
mark: startle 使吓一跳，使惊奇She startled by a strange popping sound.

speaker: Alice
content: Her curiosity aroused, Mrs. Huber tried to think of a reason for dropping in on me unannounced.
mark: curiosity 好奇心，求知欲
arouse 引起，激起；叫醒 Her curiosity aroused.
think of a reason 想出一个理由
drop in on sb unannounced. 不请自来 drop in on sb 突然拜访某人 unannounced  突然的；未经宣布的；未通知的

speaker: Alice
content: After some initial hesitation, she decided to return the blender she had borrowed from me six months before.
mark: initial adj. 开始的，最初的；
hesitation 犹豫，不情愿
blender 搅拌机

speaker: Huber
content: It's my neighbor. I think she's been shot. There's blood everywhere.

speaker: Huber
content: Yes, you've got to send an ambulance. you've got to send one right now.
mark: have got to 不得不，必须
ambulance 救护车

speaker: Alice
content: And for a moment, Mrs. Huber stood motionless in her kitchen, grief-stricken by this senseless tragedy.
mark: motionless 静止的；不运动的 stood motionless 站立不动
grief-stricken 极度悲伤的 grief 悲伤，悲痛 stricken 受灾的，患病的
senseless 愚蠢的；无知觉的；无意识的
tragedy n. 悲惨事件，惨剧；悲剧（作品）；不幸，遗憾；

speaker: Huber
content: If there was one thing Mrs. Huber was known for, It was her ability to look on the bright side.
mark: bright 明亮的；鲜艳的；聪明的；欢快的，有活力的；光明的，有希望的；
